titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1218) to amend title 18, United States Code, to prohibit taking minors across State lines in circumvention of laws requiring the involvement of parents in abortion decisions.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-211, by Mrs. Myrick.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 79.

action.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1218 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 233.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/29/1999--Introduced. Sets forth the rule (closed) for the consideration of H.R. 1218 (prohibiting interstate transportation of minors to avoid parental involvement in abortion decisions).
